Pre-Game Insights: Illness a concern for Sri Lanka as they flag off new era alongside India
For India, Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Ravindra Jadeja have retired from the format and Suryakumar Yadav has been named the new captain
Sri Lanka have moved on from Angelo Mathews, while Charith Asalanka has replaced Wanindu Hasaranga at the helm
India recently ended their long-awaited ICC trophy drought by winning the 2024 T20 World Cup
Sri Lanka were knocked out in the first round of the 2024 T20 World Cup
India sent a second-string side to Zimbabwe where they won the five-match T20I series 4-1
Sri Lankan players were busy with the Lanka Premier League where Asalanka led Jaffna Kings to the title
Jasprit Bumrah has been rested for this series
Sri Lanka lost Dushmantha Chameera (bronchitis), Nuwan Thushara (broken finger), and Binura Fernando (hospitalised with a chest infection)
There is a flu going around the Sri Lankan camp, forcing them to call up allrounder Ramesh Mendis as a standby
Matheesha Pathirana was the joint second-highest wicket-taker in the LPL with 15 scalps in nine matches
Shubman Gill has been named the vice-captain for both ODIs and T20Is
Miscellaneous Highlights: In the LPL, the average first-innings total in Pallekele across five matches was 185
Spinners fared much better in the LPL, registering an economy of 7.64, as compared to fast bowlers, who went for 10.58 runs per over
There is a forecast for rain during the daytime but not in the evening
Sri Lanka have beaten India only once in a bilateral T20I series, when they won 2-1 at home in 2021
India have won 15 out of 16 T20Is they have played this year
Suryakumar Yadav is currently fifth on the list of most sixes in T20Is
Others: Charith Asalanka on being the captain: 'I don't want to change a lot. I want to try to get the best out of my players, and build an environment where they can be free and do their best.'

Suryakumar Yadav on Hardik Pandya's role in the side: 'Hardik [Pandya] has had the same role throughout and that's not going to change. He's a very important player for the team and we want him to continue the things he did in the World Cup.'
